page.title: 02AN ADULTS DAY IN NAG'S HEAD
page.content: My name is Joan Oxberry and I am a housewife. At 7.50 a.m. I got up, breakfasted with my husband George on muesli and coffee and woke Amanda my daughter and our spaniel Gwynne. After making a feed for Kizzy, my horse, I drove to the stable at Hampton Fields, to groom her. We rode past Gatcombe Farm and then I went home to tidy the house. I was ready for my lunch of toasted cheese, yoghurt and coffee. Then it was time for a walk with Gwynne through the wet Cherington Woods. Kizzy had to be fed again and I mucked her out. For tea George had bread and cheese and I had fish fingers and baked beans. We watched television and I made hot chocolate. Amanda showed us her costume for a play and then at midnight it was bedtime.
